div.p: In a population with overlapping generations, intense selection can perturb the age distribution and thus 52 affect the rate of increase of an advantageous allele. We found that the age-specific nature of intense 53 selection, such as that generated by many diseases, can affect the response of selection on, for example, 54 loci conferring disease resistance. We also found that the temporal dynamics of selection alter the speed 55 of evolution, particularly when selection is intense, and even more so when it is age-specific. We relate
